intro: Geonoma spruceana var. major, commonly known as the giant spider-fern, is a striking tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its large, leathery fronds that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant exhibits a unique growth habit, with a creeping rhizome that supports its extensive foliage. Its fronds are divided into broad, serrated segments, giving it a distinctive and dramatic appearance. This species thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests and cloud forests.
